etymologies: early 19th century: from French iode (from Greek iōdēs ‘violet-colored’, from ion ‘violet’ + -eidēs ‘like’) + -ine

definitions: the chemical element of atomic number 53, a nonmetallic element forming black crystals and a violet vapor.

notes.text: A member of the halogen group, iodine occurs chiefly as salts in seawater and brines. As a constituent of thyroid hormones it is required in small amounts in the body, and deficiency can lead to goiter

definitions: a solution of iodine in alcohol, used as a mild antiseptic.
shortDefinitions: solution of this in alcohol, used as mild antiseptic
